docs.snippet: Anne Hathaway, coolly sipping a glass of Perrier-Jouet champagne, looked much too calm and much too rested for this stage of the awards-season rat race. How was it possible for her to be so Zen while trooping from fete to fete on the Friday before...
docs.lead_paragraph: Anne Hathaway, coolly sipping a glass of Perrier-Jouet champagne on Friday night, looked much too calm and much too rested for this stage of the awards-season rat race. How was it possible for her to be so Zen while trooping from fete to fete just days before the Oscars? "Easy, I'm not winning," she said, flashing that trademark smile. "I honestly feel no pressure." But wasn't the party circuit alone exhausting? "Oh fine," she said, leaning in close to whisper in our ear, "I did get a massage a little earlier."
docs.abstract: Anne Hathaway, coolly sipping a glass of Perrier-Jouet champagne, looked much too calm and much too rested for this stage of the awards-season rat race. How was it possible for her to be so Zen while trooping from fete to fete on the Friday before the Oscars?

headline.main: L.A. Dispatch: A Moment of Zen

docs.snippet: It is estimated that ABC is charging about $1.4 million to $1.7 million for each 30 seconds of commercial time on the Academy Awards on Sunday, or as much as 20 percent less than last year....
docs.lead_paragraph: It is estimated that ABC is charging about $1.4 million to $1.7 million for each 30 seconds of commercial time on the Academy Awards on Sunday, or as much as 20 percent less than last year, Stuart Elliott reports. "By comparison, the most recent rates were estimated at $1.8 million for 2008 and $1.7 million for 2007."
docs.abstract: It is estimated that ABC is charging about $1.4 million to $1.7 million for each 30 seconds of commercial time on the Academy Awards on Sunday, or as much as 20 percent less than last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: "The Dark Knight" may not be up for best picture tomorrow, but its backers can always dry their tears with a lot of cold, hard cash. The film, a favorite among many Oscar ninnies, just passed $1 billion in global bank.

docs.snippet: 11 P.M. (Comedy) AISHA TYLER IS LIT: LIVE AT THE FILLMORE The 6-foot-tall Ms. Tyler, right, who graduated from Dartmouth with a degree in political science, riffs on staying in shape, married life, honesty, her drinking habits and her good looks a...
docs.lead_paragraph: 11 P.M. (Comedy) AISHA TYLER IS LIT: LIVE AT THE FILLMORE The 6-foot-tall Ms. Tyler, right, who graduated from Dartmouth with a degree in political science, riffs on staying in shape, married life, honesty, her drinking habits and her good looks at the Fillmore Theater in San Francisco. 5 P.M. (IFC) SPIRIT AWARDS The ceremony honoring achievement in independent filmmaking (best feature nominees: ''Ballast,'' ''Frozen River,'' ''Rachel Getting Married,'' ''Wendy and Lucy,'' ''The Wrestler'') is broadcast live from the beach in Santa Monica, Calif., with Steve Coogan as host. An edited version will be shown on AMC at 10.
